div.l: Be god riȝt be the hoper wol I stond
Quod Iohn and se how þe corn̄ goos yn
Ȝit saw I nevir be my fadir kyn
How þe hoper waggis to and fro
Aleyn answerd Iohn wolt thou so
Than wol y be benethe by my croun
And se hou þe mele fallis a doun̄
In to þe trowgh that shul be my disport
For Iohn in faith I may be of your sort
Ay as ille a myllere as is ye
This myller smyled of her nycete
And thouȝte al þis is don but for a wyle
Thay wene that noman may hem begile
But be my thrift ȝit shal I blere her ye
For al here sleyȝte and her philosophie
The more queynte crekis þᵗat þey make
The more shal I stele whan I take
In stede of flour ȝit wil I yeue hem bren
The grettist clerkis be not wisest mengmegmen
As whilom þe wolf spak to the mare
Of al her art ne counte I not atare
Out at þe dore he goth ful pryueli
When þᵗat he saw his tyme softly
He lokith vp and doun til he hath founde
Thize clerkis hors where þey stood ybounde
Behynde the mylle vnder a leefseel
And to the hors he goth faire ⁊and wel
He stripith of the bridil riȝt anon̄
And whenne the hors were lovs þey gan gon̄
Toward the feld where wilde maris ron̄ rynne
And forth with wᵗith wehy þurȝ þicke ⁊and thynne
This myllere goth ayen no word he saide
But doth his note ⁊and wᵗith þe clerkis pleide
Til þat her corn was feire ⁊and wel I grounde
